articles.title: See what Alexander Dugin said about Trump and Putin in 2017 - CNN Video
articles.description: CNN's Clarissa Ward interviewed Alexander Dugin an influential Russian philosopher and Putin ally in 2017, shortly after former President Trump took office. Dugin says he was a supporter of President Trump's nationalist philosophy and predicted that Putin and…

articles.author: Paradise Afshar
articles.title: Rescue crews are searching for a hiker in Utah after flash flooding
articles.description: Rescuers continue searching for a hiker in southwestern Utah after a flash flood struck in a national park.
articles.content:
Rescuers continue searching for a hiker in southwestern Utah after a flash flood struck in a national park. 
More than 20 people looked Saturday for Jetal Agnihotri of Tucson, Arizona, near the Virg… [+1280 chars]

articles.title: Darya Dugina video: Russian media says explosion killed daughter of Putin ally - CNN Video
articles.description: Darya Dugina, the daughter of influential Russian philosopher Alexander Dugin was reportedly killed on Saturday when the car she was traveling in exploded near the village of Bolshiye Vyazemi, Moscow Region, according to Russian state news agency TASS.

articles.author: Fred Pleitgen, Mohammed Tawfeeq, Josh Pennington, Jonny Hallam
articles.title: Daughter of 'spiritual guide' to Putin's Ukraine invasion killed in car explosion: Russian media
articles.description: Darya Dugina, the daughter of influential Russian philosopher Alexander Dugin, was reportedly killed on Saturday when the car she was traveling in exploded in the Moscow region, the Russian state news agency TASS has reported.

articles.author: Opinion by Frida Ghitis
articles.title: Opinion: Some Russian and Chinese citizens are voting with their feet
articles.description: Putin and Xi will continue to claim their systems are superior to democracy. But those who disagree with them at home, unable to speak out, will either keep quiet, keep their criticism to barely-audible whispers, or vote with their feet, writes Frida Ghitis.
articles.content: Frida Ghitis, (@fridaghitis) a former CNN producer and correspondent, is a world affairs columnist. She is a weekly opinion contributor to CNN, a contributing columnist to The Washington Post and a c… [+6551 chars]

articles.title: Louisiana state officials delay flood funding to New Orleans a second time over city officials' stance on abortion

articles.author: Tara John and Cecelia Armstrong, CNN
articles.title: Ukrainian grain deal 'lays groundwork for permanent peace environment,' says Turkey
articles.description: Some 27 ships loaded with grain have left Ukraine's Black Sea ports since August 1 under an export deal brokered by the United Nations and Turkey, which has laid "the groundwork for a permanent peace environment," Turkey's Defense Minister said in a speech on…

articles.author: Analysis by Harry Enten, CNN
articles.title: Analysis: Mitch McConnell is right. Senate Republicans have a candidate problem.
articles.description: We've become used to displays of braggadocio by politicians (see former President Donald Trump). That's why it's notable when a politician admits that the political winds might not be going their way.

articles.author: Paul Vercammen, CNN
articles.title: Would you rip up your lawn for $6 a square foot? Welcome to drought-stricken California
articles.description: The megadrought affecting the American West has been record-breaking, with no tangible relief in sight. It's forcing cities to crack down on lawn-watering, and paying residents to replace their lawns with drought-resistant plants.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Russia's version of Starbucks reopens with a new name and logo
articles.description: A restaurateur and rapper duo unveiled Stars Coffee on Thursday, reopening the chain of coffee shops in Russia formerly owned by Starbucks, the latest major company rebranding after a months-long Western corporate exodus from the country.
